text: There they have stayed uselessly locked up because Germany has no tradition of trading abroad. In addition the strength of Germany's trading position has attracted speculators to hold marks rather than pounds or dollars, hoping for the mark to rise, as has now happened. WILL the new valuation be enough to correct Germany's massive trading surplus and choke off speculation against dollar and pound?
